WorkItem.Description:
So I chose only 1 Gemset. (Blue 10spirit12spelldmg, Red 23 spelldmg, Orange 12 spelldmg 10 haste, meta CSD).
 
Works perfectly, everywhere.
 
Except: Sometimes Optimize suggests 1(!) 16 hit gem (the rare, yellow one).

Comments.Message: Do you have it marked on the gem chart?

"Gem Chart"?
In "Gemming Templates" I only have 1 Checkbox active, and thats the Epic (Purified) one.
In "Epic (Purified)" I also only have 1 Checkbox active, and thats the one with: 23 spellpower, 10 haste 12 spellpower, 12 spellpower 10 spirit, 23 spellpower (again?), and CSD
I made a screenshot to show it. I hope png works here.

The Optimizer doesn't use gemming templates. It considers gems from active gemming templates as available, as well as all other gems you have marked available. In this case, you have that gem marked available.

Oh. 
Ok sorry close/delete this then.
Hm... can I tell the optimizer to always match the socket color?
Or make the optimizer not switch gems around? I want to save some gold by not swapping gems.

Why would you want it to always match gem socket colors? That would only result in inferior gear sets.
We are working on a method for the Optimizer to try and put gems back into their original places after an Optimize, so long as it doesn't change the total score (meaning we are *only* moving gems around that won't make/break socket bonuses).
UNTIL that functionality starts to work, you don't have to go buy the gems to match Rawr, you can move the gems around in Rawr first yourself.
To save some gold I want optimize to not swap gems.
Nothing is coming to only match socket bonuses, as that would be silly. But in tomorrow's release, it should no longer swap gems with no performance gain.

Well I have a performance gain, but its like 1 dps. And 200g for 1dps is too expensive for me.

Also Question: Why does Optimizer use the 16 hit (blue) gem (screenshot) instead of the epic one??

If 200g for 1dps is too expensive for you, then don't do it.
The optimizer uses the 16hit gem in that screenshot because it provides the most DPS of any gem you have available for that socket. ie, check if you have the epic one available.

Astrylian, I'm still seeing the gems moving around. Try loading Levva, Khadgar, EU and run optimise. You will need to mark Stormpike Cleaver & The Grinder weapons as unique to prevent optimiser trying to use two Stormpike Cleavers. I'm seeing examples where it's just shifting the gems around and not gaining or losing socket bonuses. Naturally given the nature of the optimiser its not always repeatable.

Oh -.- I still had that gem selected.

All optimize does now is place a 23 spelldmg (red) gem into a blue socket for 3 more dps. I guess I'll just ignore that then for now, since I have ffb for dual (which likes the 12spirit10spelldmg one better).

Levva can you be a bit more specific about what settings have to be set or upload a character file where that happens? When I follow your instructions the optimizer suggests swapping a number of gems for hit gems and I'm not sure if that's what you're seeing. Note that the current postprocessing only reduces the number of unneeded gem swaps, it does not guarantee a minimum number of swaps.
